descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course introduces students to Technology, Inequality and Societal Impacts (intended and unintended) of technology, with the goal of helping students develop arguments as to whether technology helps close, or exacerbate, inequality gaps. The course will use case studies to examine ways in which technology has affected inequality. There are several studies that have examined the impact of technology on labor, but not much on how technology has affected gaps in inequality.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value:
After taking this course, students should be able to show they can:

  • Students will be able to describe and discuss the five types of inequality (Political, Outcome, Opportunity, Treatment and Membership)

  • Students will have an understanding of the relationship between emerging technologies and the ongoing quest for equality

  • Evaluate and form arguments

  • Research, analyze and use evidence from case studies and articles to develop and argue positions

  • Develop literature reviews using NU Library resources

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value:
• Participation in instructor- and student-led discussions 15%

  • Quizzes (3)- 15%

  • Two analytical essays 30%

  • Final paper and presentation 40%
